contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2012}} {{No footnotes|date=October 2011}} {{otherships|USS Columbia}} {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image=[[File:Bombardment of Muckie.jpg|200px]] |Ship caption=''Columbia'' and ''John Adams'' bombarding Muckie, Sumatra, 1 January 1839 }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country=United States |Ship flag={{USN flag|1861}} |Ship maiden voyage=May 1938 |Ship name=USS ''Columbia'' |Ship ordered= |Ship builder=[[Washington Navy Yard]] |Ship laid down=1825 |Ship launched=9 March 1836 |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned= |Ship decommissioned= |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship renamed= |Ship struck= |Ship honors= |Ship fate=Burned, 21 April 1861 |Ship status= |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class={{Sclass|Raritan|frigate}} |Ship displacement= {{convert|1726|LT|t|lk=in|abbr=on}} |Ship length={{convert|175|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship beam={{convert|45|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship draft= |Ship depth={{convert|22|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship propulsion=Sail |Ship sail plan= |Ship speed= |Ship range= |Ship complement=480 officers and men |Ship armament=4 × {{convert|8|in|mm|abbr=on}} smoothbore guns, 28 × 32-pounder (15 kg) guns, 22 × 42-pounder (19 kg) [[carronade]]s |Ship notes= }} |} The first '''USS ''Columbia''''' of the [[United States Navy]] was a three-masted, wooden-hulled sailing [[frigate]] bearing 50 guns of the [[US Navy]]. She was built at [[Washington Navy Yard]]. Her [[keel]] was laid in 1825, but as was typical of much Navy construction during this period, she was not launched until 9 March 1836. On her first cruise, from May 1838 – June 1840 with Lieutenant [[George A. Magruder]] in command, ''Columbia'' rounded the [[Cape of Good Hope]] to become [[flagship]] of [[Commodore (United States)|Commodore]] [[George C. Read]] in the [[East India Squadron]]. She returned to the United States by way of [[Cape Horn]], becoming one of the first U.S. naval ships to circumnavigate the globe. She participated in the 1838 [[Second Sumatran Expedition]] in response to a Maylay attack on an American merchant vessel. ''Columbia'' served as flagship of the [[Home Squadron]] from January–May 1842; cruised on [[Brazil Squadron]] from July 1842 – February 1844 and in the [[Mediterranean Squadron]] from May–December 1844. She returned to the Brazil Squadron as flagship from November 1845 – October 1847, and was placed [[in ordinary]] at [[Norfolk Navy Yard]] upon her return home. Except for a cruise as flagship of the Home Squadron from January 1853 – March 1855, she remained at Norfolk until the outbreak of the [[American Civil War]]. ''Columbia'' was scuttled and burned by Union forces to avoid her capture by [[Confederate States of America|Confederates]] upon the surrender of Norfolk Navy Yard on 21 April 1861. Following the close of the war she was raised and sold at Norfolk on 10 October 1867. ==See also== *[[Glossary of nautical terms]] *[[List of sailing frigates of the United States Navy]] ==References== *{{DANFS|http://www.history.navy.mil/danfs/c11/columbia-i.htm}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Columbia (1836)}} [[Category:Sailing frigates of the United States Navy]] [[Category:Ships built in the District of Columbia]] [[Category:United States Navy South Carolina-related ships]] [[Category:Ships of the Union Navy]] [[Category:1836 ships]] [[Category:Shipwrecks of the American Civil War]]
